user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_check_response_header_token_ci:
```c
bool
MHD_check_response_header_token_ci (const struct MHD_Response *response,
                                    const char *key,
                                    size_t key_len,
                                    const char *token,
                                    size_t token_len)
{
  struct MHD_HTTP_Res_Header *pos;

  if ( (NULL == key) ||
       ('\0' == key[0]) ||
       (NULL == token) ||
       ('\0' == token[0]) )
    return false;

  /* Token must not contain binary zero! */
  mhd_assert (strlen (token) == token_len);

  for (pos = response->first_header;
       NULL != pos;
       pos = pos->next)
  {
    if ( (pos->kind == MHD_HEADER_KIND) &&
         (key_len == pos->header_size) &&
         MHD_str_equal_caseless_bin_n_ (pos->header,
                                        key,
                                        key_len) &&
         MHD_str_has_token_caseless_ (pos->value,
                                      token,
                                      token_len) )
      return true;
  }
  return false;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
MHD_str_has_token_caseless_ (pos->value,
                                      token,
                                      token_len)
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: MHD_check_response_header_token_ci calls MHD_str_has_token_caseless_, which is a different function. There is no evidence in the provided fragment that MHD_str_has_token_caseless_ calls MHD_check_response_header_token_ci (directly or indirectly) or that either function calls itself. Therefore Rule 17.2 is not violated by this call. (Note: to be absolutely certain, inspect the implementation of MHD_str_has_token_caseless_ and any functions it calls to ensure no call cycle back to MHD_check_response_header_token_ci.)
